channel.title: Need help, please?
channel.description:
Hey guys/Girls..
Haven't been on Mopar for a while, few months now.. Lost all I know about these Private servers..
I just need to know how to get a Client I downloaded to work.
- YES, I have extracted it to a file or my desktop..
This is what the compiler is saying; [code]'javac' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file. Press any key to continue . . .[/code]
And..
- The Run.Bat won't load. (It pops, up then closes)
[code]@ECHO ON TITLE Client javac *.java[/code]
It'd be grand if someone could help, and let me know how to solve this problem.
Thanks Guys/Girls!
~ TBH.
### EDIT ###
YES, I do have the LATEST Java!
##########[br][br][size=1]Posted on: February 28, 2008, 02:40:39 PM[/size][hr]:(

item.title: Need help, please?
item.dc:creator: @Tbh_I_Own Tbh I Own
item.description:
@Tbh_I_Own wrote:

Thanks guys, all works now.

I’d give ++ if I could, but sadly, I can’t.

Sorry!

THANKS!

Read full topic

item.title: Need help, please?
item.dc:creator: @Random666 Random666
item.description:
@Random666 wrote:

To add CLASSPATH and PATH go to:
My Computer >View Sytem Information >Advanced >Environmental Variables
Click “New” in User Variables; type CLASSPATH in variable name, and for type add:
CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_04\bin;%CLASSPATH%
And FOr PATH Do the same thing exept for “variable type”. Instead add:
CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_04\bin

Read full topic

item.title: Need help, please?
item.dc:creator: @andynerd andynerd
item.description:
@andynerd wrote:

try this @echo off title Server Compiler "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_04\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java pause[br][br][size=1]Posted on: February 28, 2008, 02:51:35 PM[/size][hr]right click on the compiler and click edit and then replace everything with that code

Read full topic

item.title: Need help, please?
item.dc:creator: @Tbh_I_Own Tbh I Own
item.description:
@Tbh_I_Own wrote:

Okay…

got the latest JDK.

Checking the other.

Okay, done all that.

NOW, I get this;

C:\Documents and Settings\Compaq_Administrator\Desktop\Dogs client v7>TITLE Client
C:\Documents and Settings\Compaq_Administrator\Desktop\Dogs client v7>javac *.java

Black screen disappears, then nothing else comes up.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help, please?
item.dc:creator: @Random666 Random666
item.description:
@Random666 wrote:

Do you have JDK?
If you do, your compiler’s got the wrong directory to javac.exe. RIght click and then choose edit and edit the directory.
And for run.bat you probably need to add “classpath” and “path” to your user variables so it recognises your JDK and stuff

Read full topic

item.title: Need help, please?

Hey guys/Girls…

Haven’t been on Mopar for a while, few months now…
Lost all I know about these Private servers…

I just need to know how to get a Client I downloaded to work.

  • YES, I have extracted it to a file or my desktop…

It’d be grand if someone could help, and let me know how to solve this problem.
